alert.note: Alert for Burlington (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 20 at 5:24PM EDT until May 20 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL OCEAN AND SOUTHEASTERN BURLINGTON COUNTIES... At 523 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Shamong, or 26 miles southwest of Toms River, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Tabernacle, Shamong, Tuckerton, Wharton State Forest, Bamber Lake, Atsion, Brookville, Warren Grove, Bass River State Forest, Chatsworth, Old Halfway, Penn State Forest, Leisuretowne and Ocean Acres. This includes Garden State Parkway between mile markers 56 and 60. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for southern New Jersey. This is a dangerous storm. Prepare immediately for large destructive hail capable of producing significant damage. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
